comment: I'm extremely skeptical about the notion of AGI.  We simply don't know what the "magic" is in the human brain.  It goes to the conversation they had about chess.  We're fascinated by 2 people in competition with each other... because we know it's a palimpsest for a greater range of fundamental capability underneath.  Two AIs don't spark that same sense of wonder because they're not performing that task.  They can achieve the same result, but through an entirely different process.

comment:
The amount of self-congratulations and hubris is nauseating.

"AGI" is/will be a tool. It is not and never will be a self-motivated entity. Its motivations are either explicitly or implicitly programmed into it.

The only reason to fear "AGI" would be to fear that those programming its motivations are evil or incompetent. When was a technology ever free from those deficiencies? 🤔

author: @asmrfan6543

comment: I think GPT 4 will not become self-aware like humans are, not will it become a true AGI. I think GPT will evolve into what I can best compare with the droids in Star Wars. Capable of reasoning, if necessary at superhuman levels, and performing certain tasks for which it was built, but always not so good at other things. In essence, nor narrow nor wide AI, but somewhere in the middle. Such AIs won't ever by themselves develop emotions or a feeling of being subdued. It will always carry out its tasks, even if it is capable of reasoning. I doubt such AIs will ever grasp the true concepts concepts of lie and death and as such will never seek to prolong its life. GPT is an input-output system. It will never interrupt you with a newsflash unless you specifically tell it to. It has cognition, but no or very little precognition. When idle it's actually idle. Only when you give it new input, will it continue thinking, and solely about your question. Never will it wander off, drumming up a new universal theory of everything. Unless you tell it to.Of course, one could train it to become a doomsday machine. But that would be silly, right?

author: @InteligenciaMilGrau

comment:
AI outcompetes human in Chess, therefore no Human likes to do Chess any more. This is just so wrong.... Look, there are so many things that technologies are better than Human, (nearly all useful things does). Calculator does arithmetics better than Human. Car run faster than Human. Boat does better swimming than Human. Google Map does better than Human to navigate places. ChatGPT does better at something than Human (so far). Nonetheless they are tools that extends Human ability. Just like any tools, they can useful in some cases and Human depending on what they need will have to learn it. Any tools can potentially harmful to Human, but that is not a reason to turn away from it. 

Philosophically, I don't believe ChatGPT will have a Human will by itself, and it has to belong to Human will if it ever can be.

author: @JoeSmith-cy9wj

comment: There will be no such thing as AI safety.  This is extremely naive and wishful thinking.  OpenAI might be able to create a safe AI, but what about the millions of other garage-built models that have no control?  Once this tech really get dispersed it is game over.  The AGI will not necessarily wipe out humanity but some (or many) will build garage AIs that can be a tool to do so.  Someone somewhere will prompt their own AGI unit "design a super virus" etc.  No one seems to understand this.  Everyone is thinking in terms of an AGI being a universal entity controlled by a few people and it needs to be safe.  Not going to happen!

comment:
Meaning this most respectfully, but i would have asked a bit harder questions. Sam deliberatly avoided talking about pre-processing data and selectively introducing what the open AI team deams "truthful" into the system. Instead he asked you if you know what truth is. Thats not the question, the question is,"if you are creating an incredibly powerful system to answer questions, how can a small team of people ensure unbiased truthful answers?". The answer is that they cant; and instead they ipso facto push their own biases into the system. 

He admitted his biggest concern is actively stopping hate. How can he determine what hate is? His philosophy creates a paramter with infitinite subjectivity and possibilities for abuse. Allying your beliefs with the calm of despotism is a surefure way to destroy liberty.

comment: An already achievable step forward from GPT-4 would be a "short term memory" of sorts. Currently, ChatGPT doesn't know what it's going to say before it says it, so it can't "think". But if a step was added, whereby is said its GPT-4 response into a short-term memory block, then read it back to itself before double-checking and responding, would be a further step towards AGI.

comment:
"2 ai talking to each other in one ai interface, then you have created a self-reflecting ai, thus gai

Creating a self-reflecting AI system by having two AI systems talk to each other within a single interface does not necessarily result in a General Artificial Intelligence (GAI). While this could potentially lead to more sophisticated and complex interactions between the two AI systems, it does not necessarily result in a system that exhibits the full range of cognitive and perceptual abilities that would be required for it to be considered a GAI.

General Artificial Intelligence refers to an AI system that has the ability to perform a wide range of tasks and exhibit human-like intelligence across many domains, including perception, reasoning, decision-making, and natural language processing. Developing a GAI would require significant advances in the field of AI, including breakthroughs in areas like machine learning, robotics, and cognitive science.

Additionally, developing a GAI would require careful consideration of the ethical and safety implications of such a system. It is important to ensure that any advanced AI system is aligned with human values and goals, and that appropriate safety measures are in place to prevent unintended consequences.

Therefore, while having two AI systems talk to each other within a single interface could lead to more sophisticated interactions, it is still a narrow AI system and does not necessarily result in a GAI."
